items.title: The Marshall Project’s Inside Story Season 2 Nominated for 2025 Peabody Award
items.description: The award-winning video series takes viewers into the lives and experiences of people impacted by the criminal justice system.

items.title: How I Became an Opera Composer in a Maximum Security Prison
items.description: I learned music theory through workshops at New York’s Sing Sing prison. I earned my stripes by singing for boisterous crowds of incarcerated critics.

items.title: All Stick, No Carrot: Ohio’s Reagan Tokes Law Acts as a ‘One-Way Ratchet’ for Prison Time
items.description: Intended to curb prison violence with promises of early release, the law is turning out as unbalanced as critics feared, with sentences extended at ev...

items.title: The Bipartisan Push to Rethink Long Sentences for Abuse Survivors
items.description: A Georgia bill offers a model for other states looking to protect people who are accused or convicted of crimes stemming from their abuse.

items.title: Who Is Billy Marshall? What to Know About Trump’s New Bureau of Prisons Director
items.description: West Virginia’s top corrections official led a troubled state agency, and will now head a federal bureaucracy plagued with problems of its own.
